wikipedia_page.main: Norah Lofts, née Norah Ethel Robinson, (27 August 1904 – 10 September 1983) was a 20th-century best-selling British author. She also wrote under the pen names Peter Curtis and Juliet Astley. She wrote more than fifty books specialising in historical fiction, but she also wrote some mysteries and non-fiction and short stories. Many of her novels, including her Suffolk Trilogy, follow the history of  specific houses and their residents over several generations.
